page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: People use cars,landcruisers,vans, bicycles,buses,tractors,scooters, motorcycles,lorries,coaches,postvans, patrol cars as a means of transport. They keep their cars in a garage if they have one.They get petrol from the petrol station.Cars needs to be taxed and insured the tax costs Â£100 per annum.Vehicles over 3 years old need a M.O.T.test to make sure the car is road worthy. The speed limit is 40 mph in this village.In towns it is either 30 or 40 mph.On a dual carriage way the speed limit is 60 to 70 mph.On the motorway the speed limit is 70 mph. A railway line runs through our squares,mostly passenger trains run on it. Aircraft,both civil and military fly overhead.
